reviews.sentence: Beautiful and spacious room. Very clean. Breakfast selection was okay. No self parking valet parking only.

Attended the Murder Mystery dinner. The hotel and amenities were very nice. I especially loved the touch screen itinerary showing not only the name of the conference room the event was in but at a touch showed a map and directions to it as well.
It was luxury at its finest from the staff to the room it was everything we wanted for our twins birthday experience. The view from the room was dreamy.
Denver Escape. Comfortable room and good breakfast. Paying 40 to Park Should be included. Hotel derails said 37.

The location of this hotel is absolutely prime if you are going to the Convention Center it is literally right across the street. Room was super clean hotel staff was so acomdating it was great. I had an issue with the valet parking and Shanleigh their Front Office Supervisor personally responded to my survey communicated back and forth with me via email and personally took care of it and then some. I will be back for sure especially because of the care Shanleigh showed after my stay. Great work.

Ok stay some highlights nothing distinguishing. The best things about this hotelbeds were comfortable and rooms were quiet even next to the elevator I did not hear noise. I love getting a microwave and sink and fridge in the romThings that were less excitingwakeup calls do not work. Both mornings. Of course I can use my phone but I always like to have backups on trips and their system just never gives you the call at least in my romelevators are SUPER ANNOYING. you have to put in your key and it is very inconsistent in whether it registers your floor before you pass it. So sometimes you are going up and down until you are able to get off on your own florfirst time in Denver this place is near 16th St but also it is a bit seedy within the few blocks near it not sure I would stay in this neighborhood next timeI was not interested in the free breakfast and cocktail hour people who care about that more might prefer this to another chain. For me this was pretty nondescript and without much distinguishing it aside from getting the microwave kitchen sink.
Comfortable clean room. Friendly accommodating staff. Nice freebies like breakfast and happy hour. More expensive than places I have recently stayed but worth the extra cost.

Comfy. Best Place to Stay. I felt as though I was at home. The bed was comfortable the bathrooms clean and the living area a welcome amenity. The breakfast and evening reception are something to look forward to.
Rooms are updated great views and friendly staff.

The stay itself was not bad friendly staff clean room. the problem is much higher up. Almost immediately after checking in muy information was shared with an outside source who is constantly offering free rooms. This call is not from Hilton can not be called back out of service but repeatedly try to get me to purchase vacation packages after starting they were free one original message. I would not think Hilton would have to make a couple of bucks sharing their customers personal information due to the prices they charge but apparently everyone has a price. I will not be staying with any Hilton property in the future.

Nice Hotel. There is so much space in the hotel rooms. Breakfast is great and was super quick for made to order. It is quiet and relaxing as well as would be great for families and business trips. Has space in the room to work but also has areas in the main lobby to work.

I had extremely high expectations due to the cost of the room and left somewhat disappointed. Breakfast was incredible. Staff was kind and accommodating. The placement of our room was creepy very dark entry. Elevators were very slow and inconvenient we chose the stairs and that was a little scary. The room seemed old and in need of updates repair. We also lost power for a portion of our stay.

Worst hotel I have been to ever. The place was dirty and hotel staff walked in to my room 2x while I was there. My room was still dirty even after it was cleaned and it took about ten minutes for the hot water to kick in. The elevators delayed coming in and out of bldg by 15 minutes. What a joke.

This is the most run down and dirtiest Embassy suites I have ever stayed at. I will never stay here again. The first room they put my family in did not even have a door between the bedroom and living room like it as supposed to. Then instead of switching me to the same type of king bed room I reserved we had to settle on 2 queen beds. There was tape holding the bathroom door frame together tape on cracks on the walls dust on EVERYTHING that was not a counter the bathroom exhaust fan was broken and covered in dust.

Wonderful People Refurbishment Way Overdue. We just returned from a 5 night stay June 23 28 2018 at Embassy Suites by Hilton Denver Downtown Conv Ctr. There is good news and bad news. Good news. The staff was uniformly eager to help pleasant and professional. Good location near the Convention Center and downtown Denver. Bad news 1. The rooms or at least the one we stayed in 1416 needs major refurbishing. 2. The bed was not good. It was overly soft and my back still feels the aftereffects. 3. There were multiple occasions when there was little or no hot water. 4. The shower head was not fastened to the wall and I was afraid to try to adjust it lest it would snap off. 5. The breakfast room traffic pattern could not be worse. The layout maximized the opportunities of bumping onto other people and spilling all the contents of one ’s tray. 6. The quality of the breakfast was poor. My wife ate breakfast the first day and would not return due to the poor quality and selection of food for the remaining four days of our stay. I ate minimally orange juice toast and perhaps a banana when they were present. This was our first stay at an Embassy Suites property and it left us with a bad impression of the brand. Hopefully this is not Hilton ’s present standard. We stayed there to attend a scientific meeting that was held at the property. The meeting went well but we were disappointed in the accommodations. Refurbishment and even renovation of this property is well overdue.

Nice hotel comfortable clean and quiet on the weekends. Everything I have come to expect from a Hilton owned property. My only complaint is that we paid for a Mountain View room but over 90 of the view is the Hyat Regency acros the street and you have to press your face against the glass to see the mountains. Otherwise very happy with our room and very cool lobby area with water features. Would stay again and would recomend to others.

This hotel should be renamed Embarrassing Suites. We were greeted by nasty smoke infested elevator. There were at least 3 homeless people in the elevator. The front desk check in was horrible. The room was just. The managers reception was a joke. They had one bartender serving at least 200 cheapskates. Plus it cost me over 350 for the stay.

Our stay was awesome will definitely stay there again. Breakfast was great i love the papas they were like home made. I fell in love with the pillows. I need to buy some for my own bed. The view was awesome from the view we had got to see all of down town. I like the work out center and the pool. was great could not have been better with the hrs. I loved that they open it so early in the morning. Staff was great and helpful during our stay. The bath room i was a little disappointed in. Even though it was nice and clean the shower and tub looked old and used. There were no vending machines for goodies. In the bathroom there is no fan that sucks. If someone poops the whole room stinks.

This is a very nice hotel located in the heart of downtown Denver. The room was very spacious and the amenities were all high quality Neutragena. The staff that I met were all friendly and very helpful. the food was excellent and the evening happy hour was welcomed at the end of a long day of conferences. The Hilton ap worked perfectly and I love the digital room key and being able to check out from my phone. The only reason I did not give this review 5stars is the following. I stayed in guest room 503. The furniture was a bit dated and the choice of an ottoman instead of an office chair for the bedroom see pictures writing desk was uncomfortable to sit at for any length of time with no back support. The single server coffee maker in my room still had water in it from the previous guest. Also there appears to be a bathroom fan vent that did not appear to be working. The vent was filled with lint and the metal was a little rusted. This caused the bathroom to steam up after a shower making the mirror useless. Other minor issues were the lobby noise could be heard in my room until almost midnight. Lastly although I am sure it is for security purposes the wire inside the glass windows the look out onto the hallway is tacky for an upscale downtown hotel. All these issues are minor but for the rate I paid for the room all week I expected everything to be perfect.

Exactly the Service you Expect from an Embassy Suites. My husband and I booked a long weekend with another couple at the Embassy Suites. Embassy is pretty much the same wherever you book across the country and you always know what to expect for the cost. We like the included breakfast buffet with tons of options and the food is really good. They also offer a nice happy hour with free wells beer wine and some very basic aps like cheese cracker and veggies. The rooms are all suites which starts with a living room bathroom in the middle and ends with the bedroom. The bed was comfortable but the living room furniture is pretty basic and not cozy at all. There is an Bar Kitchen area in the middle with a microwave and small fridge. Bathroom is pretty standard for hotels and really no extra luxuries. This Embassy is set up a little different. You walk in through the garage and have to take the elevator to the lobby. There is a nice area for seating in the lobby with plenty of room to spread out and about just for chilling happy hour or breakfast. We did hit a couple of the happy hours during our stay. It was so crazy on a Friday night you had to wait in a very long line for like 15 mins. We went back on a Sunday night and it was way less people and much more relaxed. There is a restaurant a fitness center indoor pool and convenient store with basic food and toiletries available on site. Parking is like crazy expensive so be aware. Though you can choose to use parking garages that are around the hotel and are much more affordable. The location is in an ok area of Denver. It is next to the convention center and close to the 16th Street Mall which is totally touristy but I was not really prepared for the amount of homeless people around the hotel. I know that this can be an issue when staying in a downtown area but it was a bit shady at the hotel. I would of not been comfortable if I had to walk around by myself but it was fine in a group. If you have kids and are staying here I honestly would say there are probably better places to go. So the only reason I rated this Embassy Suites 4 Stars was due to some billing issues. I booked this visit with credit card points and some how the Embassy still charged my credit card on file for three nights. I challenged this at checkout and the lady informed me the charges would be credited and not added to my credit card. Well they were still charged and it took about 10 emails back and forth to get the problem corrected. The lady that helped me Mica I think was super nice though. She said it was my credit card companies fault but whatever it turned out all good. just a lot of extra hassle.
